TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit ClassificationMetrics extends System.Object

Docs.summary: This class contains the overall metrics computed by multi-class classification evaluators.

MemberSignature.Value: public double AccuracyMacro { get; }
.property instance float64 AccuracyMacro
Public ReadOnly Property AccuracyMacro As Double
member this.AccuracyMacro : double
public: property double AccuracyMacro { double get(); };
public: property double AccuracyMacro { double get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the macro-average accuracy of the model.
Docs.remarks:
The macro-average is computed by taking the average over all the classes of the fraction of correct predictions in this class (the number of correctly predicted instances in the class, divided by the total number of instances in the class).
The macro-average metric gives the same weight to each class, no matter how many instances from that class the dataset contains.

MemberSignature.Value: public double AccuracyMicro { get; }
.property instance float64 AccuracyMicro
Public ReadOnly Property AccuracyMicro As Double
member this.AccuracyMicro : double
public: property double AccuracyMicro { double get(); };
public: property double AccuracyMicro { double get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the micro-average accuracy of the model.
Docs.remarks:
The micro-average is the fraction of instances predicted correctly.
The micro-average metric weighs each class according to the number of instances that belong to it in the dataset.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.ML.Models.ConfusionMatrix ConfusionMatrix { get; }
.property instance class Microsoft.ML.Models.ConfusionMatrix ConfusionMatrix
Public ReadOnly Property ConfusionMatrix As ConfusionMatrix
member this.ConfusionMatrix : Microsoft.ML.Models.ConfusionMatrix

public: property Microsoft::ML::Models::ConfusionMatrix ^ ConfusionMatrix { Microsoft::ML::Models::ConfusionMatrix ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the confusion matrix, or error matrix, of the classifier.

MemberSignature.Value: public double LogLoss { get; }
.property instance float64 LogLoss
Public ReadOnly Property LogLoss As Double
member this.LogLoss : double
public: property double LogLoss { double get(); };
public: property double LogLoss { double get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the average log-loss of the classifier.
Docs.remarks: The log-loss metric, is computed as follows: LL = - (1/m) * sum( log(p[i])) where m is the number of instances in the test set. p[i] is the probability returned by the classifier if the instance belongs to class 1, and 1 minus the probability returned by the classifier if the instance belongs to class 0.

MemberSignature.Value: public double LogLossReduction { get; }
.property instance float64 LogLossReduction
Public ReadOnly Property LogLossReduction As Double
member this.LogLossReduction : double
public: property double LogLossReduction { double get(); };
public: property double LogLossReduction { double get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the log-loss reduction (also known as relative log-loss, or reduction in information gain - RIG) of the classifier.
Docs.remarks: The log-loss reduction is scaled relative to a classifier that predicts the prior for every example: (LL(prior) - LL(classifier)) / LL(prior) This metric can be interpreted as the advantage of the classifier over a random prediction. E.g., if the RIG equals 20, it can be interpreted as "the probability of a correct prediction is 20% better than random guessing".

MemberSignature.Value: public double[] PerClassLogLoss { get; }
.property instance float64[] PerClassLogLoss
Public ReadOnly Property PerClassLogLoss As Double()
member this.PerClassLogLoss : double[]
public: property cli::array <double> ^ PerClassLogLoss { cli::array <double> ^ get(); };
public: property Platform::Array <double> ^ PerClassLogLoss { Platform::Array <double> ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the log-loss of the classifier for each class.
Docs.remarks: The log-loss metric, is computed as follows: LL = - (1/m) * sum( log(p[i])) where m is the number of instances in the test set. p[i] is the probability returned by the classifier if the instance belongs to the class, and 1 minus the probability returned by the classifier if the instance does not belong to the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public double TopKAccuracy { get; }
.property instance float64 TopKAccuracy
Public ReadOnly Property TopKAccuracy As Double
member this.TopKAccuracy : double
public: property double TopKAccuracy { double get(); };
public: property double TopKAccuracy { double get(); };

Docs.summary: If was specified on the evaluator to be k, then TopKAccuracy is the relative number of examples where the true label is one of the top k predicted labels by the predictor.
